title: Definitions
context: §321-222 Definitions. As used in this part, unless the context clearly requires otherwise: &ldquo;Advanced life support&rdquo; means initiating all basic life support care as well as invasive patient care designed to stabilize and support a patient&rsquo;s condition due to sudden illness or injury. The care rendered, excluding basic life support, constitutes the practice of medicine. &ldquo;Advisory committee&rdquo; means the emergency medical services advisory committee. &ldquo;Basic life support&rdquo; means initiating noninvasive emergency patient care designed to optimize the patient&rsquo;s chances of surviving the emergency situation. The care rendered consists of all first aid procedures needed, but does not include invasive procedures which constitute the practice of medicine; provided that state-approved basic life support personnel may use fully automatic external defibrillators, initiate intravenous lines, and perform manual external defibrillation under the direction and personal supervision of a mobile intensive care technician and in accordance with rules adopted by the department. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of health. &ldquo;Emergency aeromedical services&rdquo; means a secondary response system that provides immediate critical care and transport by rotary-wing aircraft of a patient to a facility that provides specialized medical care. &ldquo;Emergency medical services for children&rdquo; means comprehensive emergency medical services including preventive, pre-hospital, hospital, rehabilitative, and other post-hospital care for children. &ldquo;Emergency medical services personnel&rdquo; means any mobile intensive care technician or emergency medical technician who is certified or licensed by the State. &ldquo;First responder personnel&rdquo; means a person who has successfully completed a United States Department of Transportation approved First Responder Course of training in emergency basic life support. &ldquo;State system&rdquo; means the state comprehensive pre-hospital emergency medical services system. [L 1978, c 148, pt of §1; am L 1980, c 285, §1; am L 1981, c 93, §2; am L 1991, c 115, §1; am L 1994, c 173, §2 and c 242, §2; am L Sp 2003, c 2, §1]
